macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Decline on Trump’s Fed Chair Nomination of Kevin Warsh
items.summary: US equities fell on Friday with S&P 500 down 0.4-0.43% to around 6,939, Dow Jones down 0.37-0.4% to 48,892, and Nasdaq down 0.9-1.3% amid higher Treasury yields and stronger dollar following President Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh as next Fed Chair, signaling cautious rate cuts.

items.title: Gold Plunges 8.94% to $4,894 in Largest Daily Drop Since 1983
items.summary: Gold crashed 8.94% on Friday to $4,894.23, its steepest single-day fall since 1983, while silver saw its worst day on record down 27%, triggered by new Fed chair nomination impacting precious metals.

items.title: S&P 500 Falls Further to 6,871 on February 2, Down 0.99%
items.summary: The S&P 500 dropped to 6,871 points on February 2, losing 0.99% from the prior session, continuing pressure from Fed nomination, higher yields, and dollar strength after January gains.

items.title: Mixed Company Earnings: Chevron Beats, AmEx Misses, Verizon Surges
items.summary: Chevron rose 3.3-3.4% on profit beat and firm oil prices, Verizon surged 11.8% on strong guidance, while American Express fell 1.8% after earnings miss and Visa dropped 2.9%; Apple edged up 0.5%.

items.title: Central Banks in Focus: RBA May Hike, ECB and BoE Expected to Hold
items.summary: Markets price over 70% chance of RBA rate hike to 3.85% this week amid strong jobs and inflation; ECB likely holds as inflation nears 2%, BoE at 3.75% assessing prior cuts.

items.title: US Dollar Surges 0.90% to 97.15 Amid Fed News and PPI Data
items.summary: Dollar index jumped 0.90% to 97.15 on Friday as stronger-than-expected PPI competed with Fed chair news; Treasury yields mixed with 2-year down to 3.522%, 10-year up to 4.235%.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Cryptocurrency Market Hits Multi-Month Lows as Bitcoin Drops to $80,000
items.summary: The crypto market has retreated to multi-month lows after recent sell-offs, with Bitcoin hovering around $80,000 after losing a third from its $120,000 peak in October 2025. Overall market cap stands at $2.61T, down 1.23% in 24 hours, with BTC dominance at 59.4% and Fear & Greed Index at extreme fear level of 15/100.

items.title: Ethereum Plunges to $2,500 Amid 10% Daily Drop and Liquidations
items.summary: Ethereum has fallen to roughly $2,500, nearly half its $5,000 peak, with a sharp 10% single-day decline last week driven by derivatives liquidations. Despite price pressure, the network completed a BPO hard fork in January to boost scalability, alongside rising Layer-2 adoption.

items.title: Nasdaq Removes Position Limits on Crypto ETF Options
items.summary: Nasdaq lifted position size constraints on options for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETFs in January, aligning them with traditional commodity ETF rules. This expands institutional hedging and trading opportunities, signaling deeper crypto integration into mainstream markets.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NASA's Perseverance Rover Completes First AI-Planned Drive on Mars
items.summary: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully completed its first drives on Mars using AI-generated routes, analyzing terrain for hazards and planning safe paths autonomously on Dec. 8 and 10, marking a milestone in off-planet autonomous navigation.

items.title: IFR Releases Position Paper on AI Advancements in Robotics
items.summary: The International Federation of Robotics published a position paper on Feb. 2, 2026, detailing how AI, including deep learning, computer vision, reinforcement learning, and generative AI, is accelerating robotics capabilities in tasks like navigation, grasping, and code generation.

items.title: Google Emphasizes Human Teachers in AI Tools for Schools to Combat Cheating
items.summary: Google, an AI trailblazer, stresses the importance of teachers in educational AI use to prevent cheating and plagiarism, advocating against bypassing human oversight in schools.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds Indika, Final Fantasy II, and More in February 2026
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass has begun its February additions with Indika now available, followed by Final Fantasy II on February 3. Additional confirmed titles include Menace (Feb 5), High on Life 2 (Feb 13), and Death Howl (Feb 19).

items.title: February 2026 Gaming Lineup Features Major AAA Releases and Nintendo Switch 2 Growth
items.summary: February 2026 brings significant AAA titles including Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, Nioh 3, and Resident Evil: Requiem, while Nintendo Switch 2 targets 19 million units for FY 2026 with its 4K capabilities driving hardware demand.

items.title: Google's Project Genie AI Triggers Major Gaming Stock Selloff
items.summary: Google's announcement of Project Genie, an AI tool generating interactive virtual worlds, caused significant market panic with Take-Two Interactive dropping 8%, Unity Software falling 24%, and Roblox declining 13%, though analysts note the tool cannot yet create actual playable games.

items.title: Most Anticipated Games of February 2026 Include Dragon Quest VII and Yakuza Kiwami 3
items.summary: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined launches February 5, followed by Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties on February 11 and Romeo Is a Dead Man on February 12 as top anticipated releases.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: SpaceX Plans 1-Million-Satellite Orbital Data Center System
items.summary: SpaceX announced plans to deploy a massive orbital data center using 1 million satellites. The initiative aims to create a space-based computing network leveraging Starlink infrastructure.

items.title: SK hynix Invests $10 Billion in U.S.-Based Solutions Company
items.summary: SK hynix is investing $10 billion to establish a new U.S.-based company focused on advanced solutions. The move supports expansion in high-performance computing hardware.

items.title: Nvidia Invests $2 Billion in CoreWeave and Launches Vera CPU
items.summary: Nvidia announced a $2 billion investment in cloud provider CoreWeave and standalone availability of its Vera CPU. This bolsters high-performance computing infrastructure.

items.title: AMD and Eviden Unveil Europe's Second Exascale Supercomputer
items.summary: AMD partnered with Eviden to launch Europe's second exascale supercomputing system. The system advances high-performance computing capabilities on the continent.

items.title: Start-up Claims World's First Quantum Computer from Standard Silicon
items.summary: A start-up unveiled what it hails as the world's first quantum computer built using standard silicon processes. This breakthrough could make quantum tech more accessible and scalable.

items.title: New 3D Printing Process Improves Superconductors
items.summary: Researchers developed a novel 3D printing method that enhances superconductor performance. The technique could enable more efficient materials for energy and computing applications.

items.title: Stanford Develops Miniature Optical Cavities for Scalable Quantum Computers
items.summary: Stanford researchers created tiny optical cavities to efficiently collect light from atoms, enabling readout of many qubits simultaneously. This could support quantum computers with millions of qubits.

items.title: Robots Tested for Exploring Lunar Lava Tubes
items.summary: A European team tested three robots collaborating to map underground lava tubes on the Moon and Mars. The system creates 3D maps for future human bases in extreme environments.
